channel.title: Posts on If you torture the data long enough, it will confess ©
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on If you torture the data long enough, it will confess ©

item.title: AI Generated Stories (AWS)
item.description: Example open source event-driven application that generates a new bed time story for your children every night using Lambda, EventBridge, DynamoDB, App Runner, ChatGPT and DALL-E. Link

item.title: AWS Application Composer Now Generally Available – Visually Build Serverless Applications Quickly
item.description: At AWS re:Invent 2022, we previewed AWS Application Composer, a visual builder for you to compose and configure serverless applications from AWS services backed by deployment-ready infrastructure as code (IaC). Link Visually design and build serverless applications| Serverless Office Hours

item.title: ChatGPT Clone – OpenAI API and React Tutorial
item.description: Learn how to use React and the OpenAI API to create an application like ChatGPT. The application can answer our questions, convert the text into different languages, or even convert JavaScript code to Python. Link

item.title: ClippyGPT - How I Built Supabase’s OpenAI Doc Search (Embeddings)
item.description: Supabase hired me to build ClippyGPT - their next generation doc search. We can ask our old friend Clippy anything you want about Supabase, and it will answer it using natural language. Powered by OpenAI + prompt engineering. Link

item.title: Comparing Tools For Data Processing Pipelines
item.description: If you will ask data professionals about what is the most challenging part of their day to day work, you will likely discover their concerns around managing different aspects of data before they get to graduate to the data modeling stage. Link

item.title: Complete Solidity Course With Projects 2023
item.description: In this solidity course you will learn about solidity programming language along with that you will be building web3 decentralized solidity power web3 app. Link

item.title: Daft is a fast and scalable Python dataframe for Complex Data and Machine Learning workloads
item.description: Daft is currently in its Alpha release phase - please expect bugs and rapid improvements to the project. We welcome user feedback/feature requests in our Discussions forums. Link

item.title: Dalai
item.description: Run LLaMA and Alpaca on your computer. Link

item.title: Data & AI Infrastructure for Web3
item.description: Designed for apps and machine learning, Spice AI is helping developers working with web3 and blockchain data to build the next generation of apps. Easily get enterprise-scale data and AI infrastructure for web3. Link

item.title: gpt4 retrieval augmentation
item.description: Added new GPT4 walkthrough Link

item.title: Hamilton - The open source framework Hamilton
item.description: It’s a general purpose micro-framework for creating dataflows from python functions! Link

item.title: HOPSWORKS - Python-centric Feature Store
item.description: Easily build and manage feature, training and inference pipelines. Support for Python, PySpark, Spark, Flink, and SQL Link

item.title: Hypothesis is a Python library for creating unit tests
item.description: Hypothesis is a Python library for creating unit tests which are simpler to write and more powerful when run, finding edge cases in your code you wouldn’t have thought to look for. It is stable, powerful and easy to add to any existing test suite. Link

item.title: Jina - Build multimodal AI services with cloud native technologies
item.description: Jina is an MLOps framework to build multimodal AI services and pipelines then serve, scale and deploy them to a production-ready environment like Kubernetes or Jina AI Cloud. Jina handles the infrastructure complexity, making advanced solution engineering and cloud-native technologies accessible to every developer. Link

item.title: LangChain Chat - Next.js
item.description: LangChain Chat - Next.js Link

item.title: Langchain JS | How to Teach GPT-3, GPT-4 to Reference your own Data
item.description: ntroduction to Langchain Javascript Documentation. How to Create GPT-3 GPT-4 Chatbots that can contextually reference your data (txt, JSON, webpages, PDF) with embeddings . Brief Introduction into embeddings, vectorstorage options such as Pinecone, Chroma. Link

item.title: MODIN - Scale your pandas workflows by changing one line of code
item.description: Modin is a drop-in replacement for pandas. While pandas is single-threaded, Modin lets you instantly speed up your workflows by scaling pandas so it uses all of your cores. Modin works especially well on larger datasets, where pandas becomes painfully slow or runs out of memory. Link

item.title: Open-source vector similarity search for Postgres
item.description: Open-source vector similarity search for Postgres Link

item.title: Prefect 2 - Coordinating the world's dataflows
item.description: Prefect 2 was designed for incremental adoption into your workflows. The documentation is organized to support your exploration Link

item.description: input natural language to get stripe API calls. Link
